We believe there’s never been a more rewarding time to work in the energy, chemical and resources sectors.; As Lead Pipeline Installation Engineer, you will be responsible to provide professional technical services for the planning and execution of the offshore construction and installation scope for the big bore pipeline at both shallow and deep water.; To succeed in this role, you should have minimum 10 years’ experience in Oil & Gas sector and have 5 years of experience as Lead Pipeline Installation Engineer.  ; Who we are; Worley is a global professional services company of energy, chemicals and resources experts headquartered in Australia.; Right now, we’re bridging two worlds as we accelerate to more sustainable energy sources, while helping our customers provide the energy, chemicals, and resources that society needs now.; We partner with our customers to deliver projects and create value over the life of their portfolio of assets. We solve complex problems by finding integrated data-centric solutions from the first stages of consulting and engineering to installation and commissioning, to the last stages of decommissioning and remediation. Join us and help drive innovation and sustainability in our projects.; What you’ll do; We are looking for Lead Pipeline Installation Engineer to join our team in Indonesia.; The role responsibilities include:; ·        Provide professional technical services for the planning and execution of the offshore construction and installation scope for the big bore pipeline at both shallow and deep water; with focus on the successful execution of the project on time, within budget and in accordance with project requirements, specifications and standards.; ·        Responsible for developing the construction plan, load out, transportation & installation strategy for the offshore works (i.e. Installation crossing the trough, escarpment, shallow and deep-water zones, crossing with 3rd party facilities, and installation on top of grout bags) as well as pipeline shore pull activities.; ·        As a focal point with main responsibility of communication with other stakeholders in areas related to the construction and installation engineering, safety, quality, and operational aspects to manage and resolve technical and engineering issues in a timely manner and ensure clarity and effective management.; ·        Extensive experience in FEED and EPCI projects activities related to installation engineering of big bore and deep-water pipeline.; What you’ll have; ·        Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering; Civil Engineering or equivalent; ·        Ideally Chartered Engineer; ·        15 Years in Oil and Gas; ·        10 Years in pipeline installation engineering discipline; ·        5 Years as lead pipeline installation engineer; ·        Proficient knowledge and working experience of installation engineering involved with all phases of projects from FEED to detail design and through to construction and pre-commissioning, project management and QC controls and procedures relating to project delivery.; Moving forward together; We want our people to be energized and empowered to drive sustainable impact. So, our focus is on a values-inspired culture that unlocks brilliance through belonging, connection, and innovation.; We’re building a diverse, inclusive, and respectful workplace. Creating a space where everyone feels they belong, can be themselves, and are heard.; And we're not just talking about it; we're doing it. We're reskilling our people, leveraging transferable skills, and supporting the transition of our workforce to become experts in today's low carbon energy infrastructure and technology.; Whatever your ambition, there’s a path for you here.
